text:
*[Bug 15853] chol problem with positive semi definite matrix and pivoting*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=15853>

--- Comment #7 from Simon Wood (<mailto:simon.wood@bath.edu|simon.wood@bath.edu>) ---
The help file says:

     If 'pivot = TRUE', then the Cholesky decomposition of a positive
     semi-definite 'x' can be computed.  The rank of 'x' is returned as
     'attr(Q, "rank")', subject to numerical errors.  The pivot is
     returned as 'attr(Q, "pivot")'.  It is no longer the case that
     't(Q) %*% Q' equals 'x'.  However, setting 'pivot <- attr(Q,
     "pivot")' and 'oo <- order(pivot)', it is true that 't(Q[, oo])
     %*% Q[, oo]' equals 'x', or, alternatively, 't(Q) %*% Q' equals
     'x[pivot, pivot]'.  See the examples.

That's not always consistent with the actual behaviour.

elements.text: [Bug 15853] chol problem with positive semi definite matrix and pivoting

) ---
The help file says:

     If 'pivot = TRUE', then the Cholesky decomposition of a positive
     semi-definite 'x' can be computed.  The rank of 'x' is returned as
     'attr(Q, "rank")', subject to numerical errors.  The pivot is
     returned as 'attr(Q, "pivot")'.  It is no longer the case that
     't(Q) %*% Q' equals 'x'.  However, setting 'pivot <- attr(Q,
     "pivot")' and 'oo <- order(pivot)', it is true that 't(Q[, oo])
     %

% Q' equals
     'x[pivot, pivot]'.  See the examples.

That's not always consistent with the actual behaviour.

text:
*[Bug 18641] New: Please add grpc to Rtools*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18641>

            Bug ID: 18641
           Summary: Please add grpc to Rtools
           Product: Rtools
           Version: 4.3
          Hardware: x86_64/x64/amd64 (64-bit)
                OS: Windows 64-bit
            Status: UNCONFIRMED
          Severity: enhancement
          Priority: P5
         Component: Toolchain and libraries
          Assignee: <mailto:tomas.kalibera@gmail.com|tomas.kalibera@gmail.com>
          Reporter: <mailto:csardi.gabor@gmail.com|csardi.gabor@gmail.com>

<https://grpc.io/> would be a nice addition, so we could use it in R packages,
e.g. <https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/bigrquerystorage/index.html> could
be back on CRAN.
